arts.ttl: Werder Bremen put four past wasteful Borussia Mönchengladbach
arts.sum: Mbangula was heavily involved in Werder's second of the game just over 10 minutes later, playing a one-two with Romano Schmid before laying the ball off to Jens Stage, who finished with aplomb. Kevin Diks had a powerful long-range shot blocked by a Bremen defender and Shūto Machino sent a fierce drive against the side-netting from a tight angle, but the visitors soon grew into the game and opened the scoring with their first real attack.

arts.ttl: Gladbach's woes persist as Bremen run riot at Borussia-Park
arts.sum: Werder Bremen steamrolled Borussia Mönchengladbach 4-0 in the final fixture of Matchday 3.

Borussia Mönchengladbach were unable to produce a response to Chema Andres' 79th-minute goal last weekend as Die Fohlen were condemned to a 1-0 away defeat at the MHPArena. The hosts are winless in th...

arts.ttl: Borussia Mönchengladbach vs Werder Bremen preview: Heaven only knows
arts.sum: Two of the Bundesliga’s most unpredictable sides face off on Sunday afternoon, so who knows what to expect.
